page.title: 07CHARLTON-HANK.LANDSCAPE 2
page.content: {MANOR FARM}in{Hankerton}is an old Cotswold stone house which has been a farm for over 300 years and parts of it were built in medieval times. There are two very large barns with doorways high and wide enough to take a fully loaded wagon.The beams are hundreds of years old and the roof tiles are of stone quarried by hand in by-gone days from a field nearby.An old tunnel,still in exist- ence,connects Eastcourt House and Manor Farm but the entrances are now boarded up.THE{CHURCH OF THE HOLY {CROSS}in Hankerton dates from the 12th century with additions in the 13thc. and a chancel dated 1906.It has a 15c. barrel roof.The tower is 15th or early 16thc.perpendicular.Of the 4 bells in the peel the tenor dates from early 14thc.,2 bells from the 16thc.and 1 from the 17th century.
